kimononet.net

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • kimononet.net.Packet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parcelable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeaconPacket, DataPacket

    public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
implements Parcelable
    Each packet has to a header section and a content section. Header section consists of the following fields: 
     HDR-MAGIC (2)
 HDR-VERSION (1)
 HDR-TYPE (1)
 HDR-SRC-ID (8)
 HDR-SRC-LOC (24)
 HDR-SRC-VEC (8)
 
 Total Length: 44.
 
 The content field has variable length: 
 -content (*)
    Version:
    3/12/2012
    Author:
    Zorayr Khalapyan

      PacketType type,

        version - The version of the packet structure.
        type - The type of the packet.
        agent - The source peer agent of the packet.

    • Method Detail

      • setContents

        public void setContents(Parcel contents)
        Set's current packet's contents. The new contents will be included in the parcel returned by toParcel().
        Parameters:
        contents - Contents to set.

        Parses a parcel representation of a packet to an actual packet object.
        Parameters:
        parcel - Parcel representation of a packet.

      • getParcelSize

        public int getParcelSize()
        Returns the parcel size of the current packet. Size is calculated as header length + length of packet contents.
        Specified by:
        getParcelSize in interface Parcelable
        Returns:
        The length of the current packet.

      • toParcel

        public Parcel toParcel()
        Returns a parcel representation of the current packet. To parse the returned parcel back into a packet, use either the constructor Packet(byte[]) or the method #parse(byte[]).
        Specified by:
        toParcel in interface Parcelable
        Returns:
        A parcel representation of the current packet.

      • getContentsLength

        public int getContentsLength()
        Returns the length of the contents attached to this packet. If the packet doesn't have any contents, then 0 will be returned. To get the entire length of the packet, use getParcelSize(). Note that the method returns content's capacity as opposed to the current size.
        Returns:
        The length of the contents attached to this packet.

      • getPeer

        public Peer getPeer()
        Returns the source peer associated with the current packet. The returned peer may be a null reference.
        Returns:
        Source peer associated with the current packet.

      • getType

        public PacketType getType()
        Returns the type of the packet.
        Returns:
        The type of the current packet.

      • setType

        public void setType(PacketType type)
        Sets the type of the current packet.
        Parameters:
        type - The new type of the packet.

      • magicCheck

        public boolean magicCheck()
        Checks whether the packet's magic matches against DEFAULT_MAGIC.
        Returns:
        True if the current packet's magic byte sequence is equal to DEFAULT_MAGIC.
        See Also:
        #magic}, DEFAULT_MAGIC

        Returns a string representation of the current packet.
